graph

Class Edge<X,Y>

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.Edge<X,Y>

  • public class Edge<X,Y>
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which represents an edge in a graph. Has a value, data and two nodes source and target. All edges have a direction, that is they point away from source and towards target.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Edge(Node<X> source, Node<X> target, Y data)
      Constructs a new edge between the specified nodes and with the specified data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Y getData()
      Returns the data associated with the edge.
      Node<X> getSource()
      Returns the source node of the edge.
      Node<X> getTarget()
      Returns the target node of the edge.
      Node<X> other(Node<X> n)
      Returns the node in the edge that is not the specified node.
      void setData(Y data)
      Sets the data of the edge.
      Edge<X,Y> swap()
      Returns a new edge with the target and source the other way round.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a representation of the edge as a string.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
